Description: Coastal areas put on high alert due to cyclone Burevi formation in the Arabian Sea.
High waves reported at Kovalam, swimmers advised to be cautious.
Heavy tourist crowds at Kovalam during New Year's Eve, safety measures increased.
Red flag warnings posted on several beaches in Thiruvananthapuram.
Strong rip current warning issued for Lighthouse Beach area.
Local taxi strike impacts tourist travel from Kovalam to the city.
Fishermen advised not to venture into the sea off Kollam coast.
Algal bloom in Ashtamudi Lake affects local fishing activities.
Temporary fishing ban imposed in parts of the lake for conservation.
Wild elephant herd reported on the main road to Gavi, causing temporary closure.
Bison herd spotted near residential areas in Gavi.
Leeches reported to be a nuisance on Gavi trekking trails after rain.
Road to Gavi temporarily blocked by fallen trees after storm.
Gavi eco-tourism project temporarily suspended for annual maintenance.
Severe flooding in Kuttanad region due to overflowing rivers after heavy monsoon.
Low-lying areas in Alappuzha submerged again after a week of heavy rains.
Vembanad lake water level rises, threatening coastal communities in Alappuzha.
Relief camps set up in Alappuzha in anticipation of flooding.
Waterlogging reported in low-lying areas of Alleppey.
Houseboat operators announce a one-day strike, affecting backwater tourism.
Health advisory for tourists regarding mosquito-borne illnesses in backwater areas.
Spike in Dengue fever cases reported in Kottayam after the monsoon season.
Increase in viral fever cases reported in Kottayam.
Health department confirms a minor outbreak of Chikungunya in Kottayam.
Bird sanctuary temporarily closed as a precaution against bird flu.
Boating activities in Vembanad lake near sanctuary restricted during bird nesting season.
Major landslide in the high-range areas following incessant rainfall, blocking key roads.
Red alert issued for Idukki district due to prediction of extremely heavy rainfall.
Pettimudi landslide tragedy occurred due to heavy rainfall in the region.
Leopard spotted near a tea estate in Munnar, locals warned.
Tourism activities in Munnar affected by a local strike.
A key road in Idukki blocked for hours due to a landslide.
Another minor landslide reported near Munnar, no casualties.
Orange alert declared for Idukki, risk of landslides.
Dense fog advisory for Munnar-Top Station road, causing poor visibility.
Mild frost reported in tea estates, early morning travel affected.
Extreme waterlogging in Kochi city center paralyzed traffic for several hours.
State-wide 'Hartal' (strike) called, disrupting public transport and tourism activities.
Dengue fever alert issued for Ernakulam district post-monsoon.
Hartal leads to shutdown of shops and transport in Kochi.
Advisory about unapproved tour operators in Fort Kochi area.
Urban flooding in downtown Ernakulam after a short, intense spell of rain.
Fort Kochi-Vypin ferry service temporarily halted due to technical snag.
Traffic jam on the way to Athirappilly due to a vehicle breakdown.
Access to Athirappilly falls restricted due to rising water levels.
Water flow at falls significantly reduced, disappointing tourists.
Wild boar sightings increased near tourist areas, caution advised.
Forest fire reported in a part of Silent Valley buffer zone, contained by forest officials.
Small wildfire in the buffer zone of Silent Valley, quickly contained.
Entry to certain forest areas in Palakkad restricted due to wildfire risk.
Increased snake sightings in Silent Valley area during post-monsoon.
Trekking paths closed due to heavy rainfall and slippery conditions.
Migratory bird season delayed due to unusual weather patterns.
Poultry farms near Kadalundi Sanctuary monitored for bird flu.
High tides inundate parts of the sanctuary, affecting bird habitats.
Nipah virus outbreak confirmed, leading to health advisories and travel restrictions.
Resurgence of Nipah virus cases confirmed, containment zones established.
Health advisory issued for street food vendors at Kozhikode beach.
Third case of Nipah confirmed, high alert in Kozhikode.
Section of Kozhikode beach promenade damaged due to sea erosion.
Landslide at Puthumala village caused significant damage and displacement.
Minor landslide near Lakkidi viewpoint in Wayanad, traffic diverted.
Elephant sighting near Muthanga wildlife sanctuary, traffic regulated.
Yellow alert for Wayanad, advising caution for travelers.
Chembra peak road closed for repairs after heavy rains.
Reports of monkeys snatching food from tourists at Pookode Lake.
Drive-in beach at Muzhappilangad closed temporarily due to high tide.
Section of Kannur coast experiences unusually high tides.
Vehicle entry banned on beach due to extremely soft sand after rains.
Part of the walkway near Bekal fort damaged by sea erosion.
Thunderstorm warning for coastal Kasaragod, tourists advised to stay indoors.
Bekal Fort to be partially closed for visitors for renovation work.
Water levels in Kuttanad rise, affecting road transport to Allapy.
Continuous rain leads to waterlogging on several roads in the town.
Unpleasant smell from backwaters due to algal bloom reported by residents.
Heavy traffic jams near Infopark area due to metro construction work.
Flash floods reported in low-lying areas of Kakkanad after heavy downpour.
Jellyfish sightings increase, swimmers warned to be careful.
Warning against swimming in certain parts of the lake due to contamination.
Portions of the main access road to Gavi are in poor condition after monsoon.
Nehru Trophy Boat Race causes extreme overcrowding and traffic restrictions.
Local protest near the main tourist jetty disrupts boat services for a few hours.
Ghat road to Munnar closed overnight for emergency repairs.
Kochi-Muziris Biennale leads to heavy tourist traffic and limited parking.
Warning signs placed about slippery rocks near the falls viewing area.
Number of daily visitors to the national park capped to reduce disturbance.
Access to bird watching points difficult during extreme low tides.
A protest march along the beach road caused traffic diversions.
High wildfire risk alert issued for the South Wayanad forest division.
Police increase patrols to crack down on illegal racing on the drive-in beach.
Lightning strike reported near the fort during a thunderstorm; no injuries.
Widespread power outage in the Alleppey coastal belt after a storm.
Some hotels in Munnar report water scarcity during the peak summer season.
High tides coupled with rain cause flooding on roads near the beach.
Beach heavily overcrowded during the Malabar Food Festival.
Early landslide warning issued for hilly areas in Wayanad.
Reports of overpriced taxi fares from the beach area.
Mobile networks are unreliable or unavailable in many parts of Gavi.
Water hyacinth infestation in backwaters hinders boat movement.
Increased surveillance in the park's buffer zone following poaching intelligence.
